intro: Hypericum crux-andreae, commonly known as the Andes crosswort, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes mountains of South America. It is a member of the Hypericaceae family, which includes other well-known species like St. John's wort. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the harsh, high-altitude environment of its native habitat.
